guide.title: Releng Status Report
guide.abstract: Status report of the Releng project

body.p: This is the status report of the Gentoo Release Engineering project, commonly abbreviated as "releng". Status reports will be posted by the releng strategic manager, John Davis, on a regular basis. Questions regarding releng can be directed to the releng mailing list.
The following subjects will be covered in this status update:
Chris Gianelloni has been named the releng QA Manager. His jobs include maintenance of the livecd herd, x86 LiveCD QA and testing, and general testing of release materials. Congratulations!
Roger Miliker is now an official part of releng and will be working with beejay on x86 releases. Welcome!
2004.2 testing has been officially underway for quite some time. The PPC team has been busy building 2004.2 test releases, which are available for download.
The x86 team is working hard on improving LiveCDs and is actively tracking the progress. Test LiveCDs can be found on wolf31o2's devspace.

Catalyst will shortly be bumped to version 1.0.8.1 in Portage to reflect the changes explained below. The update is dependent on the stabilization of Genkernel 3.0.2b, so as soon as it is stable, Catalyst 1.0.8.1 will be stable as well.
The Catalyst ChangeLog contains details regarding all commits made to the Catalyst codebase, but the following highlights are of special interest:

A new option for snapshots, portdir_overlay, has been added. As you may have guessed, portdir_overlay allows for the use of a Portage Overlay directory in the Portage Snapshot. It can be invoked as so: catalyst target=snapshot version_stamp=foo portdir_overlay=/foo.
DistCC support in Catalyst has been much improved. There had been issues with bind mounts, but tweaks to the distcc process handling code in Portage should remedy those problems.
Portage snapshot creation time has been improved dramatically thanks to some rsync tweaks.
